35232142: Repair work and assessments are ongoing in areas of Scotland affected by flooding, with calls for more preventative measures and faster flood protection plans.
40143035: A fire at a hotel in Northern Ireland destroyed two tour buses, prompting police to investigate a suspected deliberate attack.
35951548: Mercedes outpaced Ferrari in Bahrain Grand Prix qualifying, with Lewis Hamilton securing pole position despite a reprimand, while newcomer Stoffel Vandoorne impressed in his debut for McLaren.
36266422: John Edward Bates faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, denying all allegations of sexual abuse made by four male complainants.
38826984: Patients and staff were evacuated from Cerahpasa hospital after a man receiving treatment threatened to shoot himself and others, but earlier reports of hostages were incorrect.
34540833: Simone Favaro scored the crucial try in the last move of the game as Glasgow Warriors defeated the Dragons in a closely contested match.
20836172: Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, 31, was killed in a hit-and-run in London, and police are seeking the driver of the Audi A3 involved in the crash.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died in a collision with a motorbike during a race, sparking concerns about safety and prompting calls for improved regulations on motorbike presence.
40758845: Ilkay Gundogan is optimistic about his recovery from injury and eager to return to the field for Manchester City's upcoming season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash at the junction of A127 and Progress Road in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex.
34615665: The first major tropical storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959 reaches highest rating, prompting questions about category definitions.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered vulnerabilities in wireless mice that allowed attackers to spoof signals and take control of computers, prompting updates from some manufacturers.
37922330: 38 staff at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell have been made redundant due to adverse trading conditions, but there is hope for some to find employment elsewhere.
30844962: The European Commission is investigating Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon, suspecting it may constitute state aid and violate EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show celebrates agricultural life with food, family fun, and local produce, featuring an "edible garden" and showcasing local livestock and family activities.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google for breaching his privacy by not blocking photos from a sex party, despite winning damages from the News of the World.
38900884: Dragons forward Eddie Jackson's injury is seen as an opportunity for other players to step up and thrive in his absence.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership receives three-year funding package to ensure language survival, but long-term support should come from Cornwall, not London.
40194700: Monaco's coach Jardim described the last three years as "exceptional" and chose to continue coaching at Monaco despite receiving offers from elsewhere.
37903647: The State Department criticized Nicaragua's election process as flawed and not free and fair, with Daniel Ortega winning by a large margin amid opposition allegations of voter abstention.
13291223: South African authorities have announced plans to address the issue of "corrective rape" targeting lesbians after global outcry.
36052570: Big oil producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss a production freeze, but skepticism remains about its impact on the oversupply of oil.
34944735: The study by US biologists found that the vibrant blue color in tarantulas is not driven by sexual selection and has evolved independently multiple times.
32159602: Andreas Lubitz's internet searches on suicide and cockpit security, along with the recovery of the second "black box," suggest intentional crashing of Flight 9525.
34988915: Former radio DJ Mr Fox denies multiple counts of indecent and sexual assault, claiming all behavior was consensual and part of workplace "horseplay" with colleagues.
37889203: Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino confirmed that midfielder Dele Alli will be sidelined for "a few weeks" due to a knee injury sustained in training.
33609927: Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with abuse in-house and reluctance to co-operate with authorities has allowed abusers to escape justice.
33578778: Yanis Varoufakis criticizes Greece's bailout program as a historic disaster, predicting its failure and resignation, while Greek Prime Minister Tsipras reluctantly accepts the bailout terms.
36888270: The IPC has opened proceedings against the National Paralympic Committee of Russia for alleged doping, with a decision on any ban expected in early August.
36846007: London Irish sign 24-year-old Ben Loader, who brings Championship experience and is seen as a valuable addition by director of rugby Nick Kennedy.
31723471: Manor Marussia F1 team secures investment from Stephen Fitzpatrick and appoints Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government has agreed on a £39m stimulus package to boost the economy, but it has faced criticism from opposition parties for being inadequate.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major warns of substantial costs and a diminished diplomatic force as the UK prepares to leave the EU.
20936833: The House of Commons is debating a bill to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, sparking a political debate over the impact on working families.
36832879: Engineers are working to repair a collapsed sewer under the tracks in Forest Hill, causing disruptions to train services in London until Wednesday.
14958201: Manchester City secured a hard-fought win against Everton with goals from Mario Balotelli and James Milner, demonstrating their title challenge credentials.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claimed to have met the target of reducing six-week delays in discharging patients, but Labour criticized her for not meeting it for over three years.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that the UK's use of overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet broke clean water laws, leading to a need for improvements.
34303109: Pope Francis visits Cuba, praising improved US-Cuba relations and urging support for Cuban Catholics, while also calling for continued detente between Cuba and the US.
39939090: Rangi Chase joins Widnes after being dropped by Castleford, eager to start games and help the struggling team.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive, Roddy Smith, is stepping down after 10 years, leaving behind a growing and successful organization with increased participation and international success.
36783415: Sunderland want Allardyce to stay as manager, but England's search for a new boss continues with Allardyce as the frontrunner.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina in a hard-fought match, with Leigh Halfpenny's penalty proving to be the difference in a game of missed opportunities and strong defensive displays.
40260829: New Zealand's Bulford Kiwi and the Terrain Model of Messines have been granted protection as scheduled monuments to honor the bravery of New Zealand's fighting forces in the First World War.
36478199: Two inmates at HMP Wayland attempted to grab keys from officers, leading to their transfer to a higher security jail and potential extension of their sentences.
34541803: Tim Sherwood deserves more time as Aston Villa manager despite early pressure and challenges with squad rebuilding.
35360841: Transport Minister Edwina Hart aims to streamline the system and reduce fraud in the transportation system, following the suspension of tough guidelines to tackle abuse.
35550407: Life expectancy for older age groups in England has risen to its highest level, but there are concerns about elderly people living in poor health and regional variations.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating hundreds of reported crimes of abuse, with many allegedly committed by council staff on council property between the 1940s and 1990s.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup quarter-final draw has been announced, with Chelsea facing Sunderland and Manchester City playing Bristol City, among other matchups.
